channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: South Korean president defends martial law decree, defies pressure to quit
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: The opposition is pressing ahead with a second attempt to impeach Yoon Suk Yeol, and there are signs some members of the president’s party will support his ouster.

item.title: Live Briefing: Syrian rebel forces dismantle symbols of al-Assad
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Leo Sands, Bryan Pietsch, Sammy Westfall
item.description: Rebel forces led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham said they took control of Deir al-Zour in eastern Syria. Israel said its extensive strikes were to prevent a future attack.

item.title: After toppling Assad, can Syria’s rebels rebuild a shattered state?
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Abbie Cheeseman
item.description: Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, the leading rebel force, must work to allay public fears that it will seek to replace Assadism with its own form of absolute rule.

item.title: Strikes continue in Gaza’s Beit Lahia, leaving more than 30 killed or under rubble
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Heba Farouk Mahfouz

item.title: Syrian rebels burn tomb of late president Hafez al-Assad
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker, Liz Sly

item.title: Who is Mohammed al-Bashir, Syria’s new caretaker prime minister?
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Iran’s supreme leader accuses U.S. and Israel of orchestrating Assad ouster
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: In his first address since the toppling of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei excoriated the United States and Israel.

item.title: Tycoon Adani pulls request for U.S. loan to finance strategic Sri Lanka port
item.dc:creator: Karishma Mehrotra, Anant Gupta
item.description: The withdrawal marks another low point in U.S.-India ties after the billionaire’s indictment on charges related to fraud, and a blow to Washington’s bid to counter China’s regional clout.

item.title: Afghan blast kills key minister, shocking Taliban
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Haq Nawaz Khan
item.description: Khalil Haqqani was the acting minister for refugees and a key member of the notorious Haqqani network.

item.title: Who is Kim Guilfoyle? Trump taps ex-Fox News host, lawyer as ambassador to Greece.
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Maegan Vazquez
item.description: Trump announced his intent to nominate Kim Guilfoyle — a former Fox News host, political fundraiser and fiancée of son Don Jr. — to become U.S. ambassador to Greece.

item.title: Iran’s supreme leader accuses U.S. and Israel of orchestrating Assad ouster
item.dc:creator: Susannah George

item.title: Armed rebels consolidate control as Syria’s map is redrawn
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands

item.title: Blinken to travel to region to press U.S. vision for Syrian transition
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum

item.title: They were filming an interview on women’s safety. Then they were harassed.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wu
item.description: In a viral video, a man interrupted a British journalist interviewing a mother on sexual harassment and made sexist comments, forcing the women to leave.

item.title: These preteen go-kart drivers are spending millions for a shot at F1 racing
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff, Claudia Gori, Zoeann Murphy
item.description: Parents are spending millions on karting for their kids, hoping it will eventually catapult them into F1 racing. It’s a mad, mad world. And we go inside.

item.title: Australian leader decries hate crimes after another antisemitic attack
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: Australian politicians are warning against “importing conflicts” after the second antisemitic attack in a week. The incidents have shaken the Jewish community.

item.title: Ukraine races to develop its own long-range weapons to counter Russia
item.dc:creator: David Stern
item.description: Ukraine has demonstrated skill with long-range drones, hitting deep inside Russia, but experts say it needs the punch and power of ballistic missiles, as well.

item.title: South Korean prosecutors weigh arresting president on insurrection allegations
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: Police tried to raid President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office in martial law investigation. Yoon’s former defense minister, who has been arrested, attempted suicide in detention.

item.title: U.S. group travels to Syria in search of missing reporter Austin Tice
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Ellen Nakashima, Dan Lamothe
item.description: The fall of President Bashar al-Assad has revived hopes that Austin Tice, a journalist abducted while covering Syria’s civil war, will be found alive.

item.title: Mazen al-Hamada, symbol of Syrian regime’s brutality, confirmed dead
item.dc:creator: Liz Sly
item.description: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.

item.title: In Syria’s former ‘slaughterhouse,’ a desperate hunt for the disappeared
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.

item.title: Israel expands airstrikes across Syria amid widening power vacuum
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Lior Soroka

item.title: U.S. would recognize a Syrian government that comes from inclusive process, Blinken says
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Annabelle Timsit, Bryan Pietsch, Kelsey Baker, Sammy Westfall, Michael Birnbaum
item.description: The Israeli strikes, days after Bashar al-Assad’s fall, targeted Syrian military facilities, including a possible chemical weapons facility, said two Western officials.

item.title: Analysis: Iran reels from ‘tectonic shift’ in Middle East amid scramble for Syria
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor

item.title: Israel expands airstrikes across Syria amid widening power vacuum
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Lior Soroka
item.description: The Israeli military said it had carried out 350 strikes on Syrian territory since Sunday, destroying weapons sites and effectively eliminating the Syrian navy.

item.title: Iran reels from ‘tectonic shift’ in Middle East amid scramble for Syria
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: As Iran deals with the strategic setback of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s ouster, a vicious cycle of confrontation and escalation could already be in motion.

item.title: About 26 killed in strike in Beit Hanoun in north Gaza, rescue workers say
item.dc:creator: Hajar Harb, Miriam Berger

item.title: Russia’s elite sound the alarm on the economy amid high interest rates
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton
item.description: Squeezed by Western sanctions and soaring interest rates, Russia’s businesses fear bankruptcies as President Vladimir Putin pushes ahead with the Ukraine war.

item.title: Netanyahu takes the stand in his corruption trial. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s court appearance comes against the backdrop of war in Gaza, regime collapse in Syria and a tenuous ceasefire in Lebanon.

item.title: China reveals its playbook for dealing with impending Trump trade war
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop, Vic Chiang
item.description: Beijing is responding to Biden administration actions decisively and swiftly — a warning to Donald Trump that it will play hardball this time, analysts say.

item.title: Netanyahu takes the stand in his corruption trial as supporters, critics gather outside
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka

item.title: Roads around Damascus littered with abandoned military vehicles and uniforms
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris
